fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users of instances integrated with Gsuite are having problems to login. Error "Your access has been revoked".

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* G Suite integrated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to login to the instance

h3. Expected Results
The user is logged in

h3. Actual Results
The user is unable to login and is presented with the error "Your access has been revoked".
 
h3. Notes
This problem is being investigated internally.

h3. Workaround
Manually sync your instance.
If you're the admin and cannot login, contact [support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: Users of Gsuite are having problems to login - "Your access has been revoked"

fields.description:
When a user navigates to a specific Confluence/Jira page with an expired login session (for example, the browser cookie value is incorrect), the user gets a 403 Forbidden Error.

When the session is expired, instead of showing the error page or a blank page, we'd like to show the Atlassian login page or the Confluence/Jira main page

Error such as :
 !0003.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Redirect page to Altassian login or Confluence/Jira Home when hit to error
Sprint dependency tree viewer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32487].
  {panel}

At the current moment, there is no method for administrator to know if there any attempt made by anyone to login into JIRA that has failed. 

For example: 
* currently the Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed is set to 3
* when there are more than 3 failed attempt made, the CAPTCHA is shown
* however, administrator are not aware that there are failed attempt unless manually checking in the Users list

It's important for administrator to know especially if the username involved is used by REST client. This is because, the REST client will not be completed as it can't pass the value of the CAPTCHA.

Suggestion: send notification to administrator of username that has exceed the fail attempt so that administrator can clear the login attempt.
fields.summary: Send notification to administrator when Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed is exceed

fields.description:

Some boards are having card colors that are tied to empty priority.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no functionality for the administrator to hide the roadmap in the nextgen project from a selected set of users. All the users who have access to the next-gen project will have the ability to see the roadmap.


h3. Current behaviour

All the users who has access to the project will be able to see the roadmap.

h3. Customer expectation

Customers wants the ability to hide the roadmap from a selected set of users based on the permissions set
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the access to roadmap in Nextgen projects to selected users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unsubscribing the Big Picture add-on does not uninstall the add-on from the instance
  

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Navigate to manage add-ons.
 # Expand the Big Picture add-on details.
 # Click on unsubscribe.
 # Now, it shows separately to uninstall or the add-on details will not be wiped off from the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution

The unsubscribe button should also uninstall the add-on from the cloud instance.
h3. Why this is important

In order to avoid any confusion and improve the user experience.
fields.summary: Removing the subscription for an add-on does not uninstall

fields.description:
In Atlassian Cloud User Administration, although application access is noted with separate checkboxes for Jira Software and Jira Service Desk, "Last active in Jira" is not separated between the two.

Proposing an improvement to separate that out into two:

"Last active in Jira"

"Last active in Jira Service Desk"

And for those to be pull from their respective data stores. I don't know the underlying schema and whether or not they are recorded separately, if not then ideally could start recording them separately and thus could report on them separately.

See Screenshot for a visual
fields.summary: Separate Last Login Time for Jira Software and Jira Service Desk

fields.summary: Users Groups usage

fields.description:
I setup domain verification with our organization and immediately, over 3000 of our users were pulled into the Managed accounts. However, the billing showed that we would be charged over $800 for around 254 users which is confusing because I hadn't granted anyone but myself access to any of the products. Also, I had received a message that we would be charged over $2000 soon for another 1000 users because support for Trello was being extended to Atlassian Cloud and we had no plans to use Trello.

The only solution I was able to receive was to disable managed accounts, however, Admins are not able to do a bulk change to disable accounts. That means I have to disable over 3000 accounts one by one.

SUGGESTIONS:
 * By default, when a domain is verified and managed accounts are pulled into the system, those users shouldn't be billed yet either by not granting access immediately and/or disabling them.
 * Admins should be able to do bulk changes to managed accounts.
 * It should be obvious on the billing site exactly why we are being billed.
 ** EXAMPLE: What product/site were 254 users being billed $800 for?
 * It would be helpful if there was a walk-through during setup to help Admin with using the Atlassian Access feature that includes how billing is managed. Confluence page was very general with its description but the billing behavior didn't seem to match the description.

MY EXPECTATIONS AS ADMIN
 * Subscribe to Atlassian Cloud Products
 * Create Organization
 * Verify Domain
 * Setup SAML single sign-on
 * Assign users/groups to specific products to control access and billing
fields.summary: Improve ability to manage billing for Managed Accounts from organization domain.
Page unavailable error when you access a domain that does not exist.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The number of members includes "System users" such as add-on apps having "*@connect.atlassian.com" email addresses, and it is confusing.
The number of users is sensitive for site-admins because it is related to site bill.

 !group-members-1.png|thumbnail!  !group-members-2.png|thumbnail! 

Go to the Cloud admin page (https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/admin/) and select "Group".

h3. Suggested Solution

Exclude "System users" from the number of "Group members".
Otherwise, clarify these numbers include "System users" that billing doesn't count them in.

h3. Workaround

Refer to the "Product access" page to know the number of license usage.
https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/admin/apps

Besides, next billing estimation is available at "Billing" > "Bill estimate".
fields.summary: Number of "Group members" does not correspond to the users listed below

fields.description:
Currently in Jira, if I'm set to be notified when someone commented on an issue because I'm the Reporter, the Assignee, and a Watcher; if someone mentions me on a comment, I'll receive only one email notification about the comment on the issue. 

It would be very helpful if we could customize the priority of notifications. 
Mention > Be Assignee > Watcher

Features request:
* Ability to set the priority of notifications
* Receive a separated email notification from the @mentions  
* Add the reason for the notification("you are receiving this email because you are ....")
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to customize and change priority the email notifications

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Users from within China experience slower performance with Atlassian products.

h2. Cause
 This is due to [Great Firewall of China|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Firewall] blocking or restricting internet contents from outside China. 

h2. Workaround
Using a VPN provider (preferably outside China) Could help boost performance. No guarantees on how much is expected.
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud Performance from within China

fields.description:
The new(ish) issue detail boxes that float in the foreground when an issue is selected are frustrating when it comes to editing because:
 # A lot of scrolling of the list on the right hand side is needed to get to the field you want to edit
 # The show more button is pointless as you anyway need to scroll
 # Some fields don't appear in that scrolling list (eg, Epic Name)

As often as not, I can't do what I need to in the floating detail box, so have to go through to additional clicks (Issue Detail > Edit) in order to get started.

If you don't want to change the floating box, fair enough, but could we *at least include the Edit option* in the 3 dot menu?

Cheers,

Max
fields.summary: Edit option missing from floating issue detail screen

fields.description:
*Summary*
The "Last active" feature in the user profile is not being displayed with accuracy, some users have their last activity shown as "Not active in the last 180 days", while other users who are also inactive for more than 180 have their last activity shown as "17 Aug 2017".

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Navigate to the User Management
2. Open the profile of a user that has not been active for a while
3. Check the user "Last active" information

*Expected Results*
If the user has not been active in the last 180 days, it should be displayed as "Not active in the last 180 days"

*Actual Results*
The actual last active date is displayed. E.g: 17 Aug 2017
fields.summary: User "Last active" information is not accurate

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Duplicate Links in Application Navigator cause 404s when clicking the Manage Links

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In an instance with both Confluence and Jira, go to the *Application Navigator* settings ({{wiki/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator}}), page in Confluence and add a link to a page in Confluence
# Now, go to to the *Application Navigator* settings page in Jira ({{plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator}}) and add the very same link - with the same name, URL and groups. (It will take sometime to replicate between the two instances due to [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-9882])

h3. Expected Results

Once you click 'Manage', you should be redirected to the other application to manage that link

h3. Actual Results

Once you click 'Manage' in one of the links, you are redirected to a non-existent URL -- such as {{https://instance.atlasian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/12345/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator}}
Also, it displays the "Manage" button for the one that was created inside the same application that you're in right now. Apparently, it confuses the items, as they have the same name, URL and groups.

h3. Workaround

Delete one of the duplicate links in the respective application.
fields.summary: Duplicate Links in Application Navigator cause 404s when clicking the Manage Links

fields.description:

fields.description:
Here is my scenario - 
I have four independent organizations under the group company. They all use GROUP.com for SAML authentication.
At this time, CompanyA has Atlassian Cloud applications including Jira and confluence. Today, CompanyB has approached me to have SAML authentication for their own Atlassian Cloud Jira. Unfortunately, CompanyB can't configure GROUP.com for SAML since CompanyA is already using it. This is a big limitation.

I am imagining, this situation can be overcome if we can have a custom domain for all cloud instances rather than "company.atlassian.net".

Please let me know if you need any clarification - 

Thanks
/Sanal
fields.summary: SSO / SAML Authentication

fields.description:
I understand that the new design was supposed to be 'more intuitive', but I don't personally know a single person who actually likes it.
 
For example: Getting to the Issue Search tool used to be a single click, now it's at least three - each one with lengthy loading times as all the bells and whistles whir up. I can't even force garbage collection in the back-end any more, which means additional bloat. I don't understand why the change was made and I don't understand why, if some users are still able to have the old interface, that I can't request that the old interface also be made available for us.
 
As I said, this is costing us hours of productivity per week. I understand that this isn't a change you are personally responsible for, but given that we've been struggling with it for months now and other companies apparently aren't having to I hope you can understand why this would make me ask the question 'how do we also go back'.
 
After talking to an Atlassian support engineer, it turns out that EVERYONE will be forced to this new interface style within the month, as the rollout was gradual.


The biggest problem with the new interface is the lack of any way to get to the JQL search screen with a single click. There is absolutely always a need to quickly access the Issue Search tool - that's how you generate filters, how you identify commonalities between items, how you access data as a whole. I don't need a primer on keyboard shortcuts, I need it to not take 45 seconds to load the screen where I input JQL.

That was what made JIRA such an incredible tool, it was scaleable and I could generate tools for my team to access the information they needed, but if you knew what you were doing you could get access to much more intricate functions (which all still exist) with the same time investment. Now, all people get is the low-end view, and you need to dig through (sometimes minutes of) loading screens to get to functions which used to be a single click away.
fields.summary: Return to old user interface

fields.description: If there is a movable "search" button, we can open the result navigator in a new tab, so that we can return to the page before searching more quickly and efficiently.
fields.summary: There should be a movable "search" button within the searching function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a URL to a Jira custom field of URL type, if the link contains certain characters, such as ć, Á, ț and other similar characters, Jira sees the URL as invalid, even if, placed in a web browser, the URL works.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a custom field of type URL
# Add a (working) URL that contains one of the characters
# Notice the error message: *Not a valid URL*

h3. Expected Results
URL should be seen as valid

h3. Actual Results
Jira reports that the URL is not valid
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: certain Unicode characters in a (valid) URL causes Jira to see that URL as not valid in a URL custom field

fields.description:
Allow customers to customize the log retention options.

We do know that the log retention is co-related to the data storage, and we can't just leave it open due to the data storage limitations, however, customers should have the option to pay for extra storage of logs if necessary.

Some customers may want to keep their logs for months, or even for years.
fields.summary: Allow customers to customize the log retention options.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 - Updating users' application access/groups it's not possible on Internet Explorer.

 !screenshot-1.png! 
h3. Environment
 - IE version 11.165.17134.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using IE, open Site administration.
 # On Users, click on a User to open their profile.

h3. Expected Results
 - It's possible to remove user's access to Atlassian products.

h3. Actual Results
 - The application access does not load, it keeps spinning.
 - On dev tools it only shows: SCRIPT438: The object does not support the 'from' property or method

h3. Workaround
 # Open "Groups" > Select the desired group > Click on "Remove user".
 ## 1 To add a user to a group, follow the same steps, but instead of "Remove", click on "Add" > Search for the user > Add user.
 # Use another browser.
fields.summary: Updating users' application access/groups it's not possible on Internet Explorer 11

fields.description: A feature that allows users to customize Jira shortcut keys would be a helpful feature in Jira. This helps users who are not interested in the default defined keys and would like the ability to customize this.
fields.summary: Customize Jira shortcut keys

fields.description:
Allow admin to activate a new Jira or Confluence instance & import Jira/Confluence data into an Atlassian Cloud with an existing Stride instance (in Suspended or Active status) without interfering with Stride data and userbase.

Currently, importing Jira and Confluence data into a Cloud with Stride will delete all stride-users unless the user was also active in the imported Jira userbase.
fields.summary: Allow admin to import Jira/Confluence data without interfering with Stride user access

fields.description:
The groups in Bitbucket should include the feature to allow one of the group users to act as "group owner" so that user can add/remove/edit users and permissions inside that group

GitHub has it ;)

Thanks!
fields.summary: Bitbucket - groups feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem description:
When updating a subscription's *Billing Details*, the *Next* button is not displayed in the screen.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Open a cloud instance
 # Open the *site administration* section
 # Navigate to *Billing > Billing details*
 # Click *Add billing details* or the *pencil button* if updating an existing credit card
 # In the following screens the *Next* button is not displayed
  !Screen Shot 2018-07-16 at 12.55.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:
 # Zoom out your screen and the button will be displayed

h3. Suggested solution:
 * Either add a scrolling bar in this screen or adjust the field size so that all information can fit the screen.
fields.summary: "Next" Button is not displayed in the Update Billing Details screen
